item.title: Covid-19: More than 75% of UK adults now double-jabbed
item.description: But Oxford vaccine chief Prof Sir Andrew Pollard warns Covid herd immunity is "not a possibility".

item.title: Afghanistan war: Biden says he does not regret troop withdrawal
item.description: The US president says Afghan leaders need to fight for their nation, as more cities fall to the Taliban.

item.title: Prince Andrew can't ignore courts, says Virginia Giuffre's lawyer
item.description: Virginia Giuffre's lawyer says litigation is the only way to establish the Duke of York's evidence.

item.title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
item.description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libya’s war.

item.title: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo resigns in wake of harassment report
item.description: The Democrat says he will step aside after an inquiry found he sexually harassed multiple women.

item.title: Winchester is now the least affordable UK city to buy a home
item.description: Winchester has leapfrogged Oxford to become the UK’s least affordable city to buy a home, says a survey.

item.title: A-level results 2021: Top grades reach record high
item.description: The second year of results after cancelled exams sees the highest level of A* and A grades at A-level.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Missing hiker's boyfriend finds her body
item.description: The body and belongings of Esther Dingley are found close to where a bone fragment was discovered.

item.title: Algeria forest fires: Dozens killed in Kabylie region
item.description: Algeria is one of several Mediterranean countries to face devastating wildfires.

item.title: Family firm with 'humble' start sells for £775m
item.description: Euro Auctions, set up in 1988 as a family business, was sold to a Canadian firm for more than $1bn.

item.title: Lionel Messi signs two-year Paris St-Germain deal after leaving Barcelona
item.description: Lionel Messi signs a two-year deal with Paris St-Germain after leaving Barcelona.

item.title: I Am Legend screenwriter dismisses anti-vax claims based on film's plot
item.description: A sci-fi writer hits back at unfounded rumours that Covid jabs turn people into zombies.

item.title: Transmitter fire disrupts TV for 1m people
item.description: More than a million people across North Yorkshire and parts of the North East were affected.

item.title: The Papers: 'A-levels overhaul' and 'Williamson in danger'
item.description: Wednesday's papers lead with a plan to fix soaring A-level grade inflation after record-high results.

item.title: A-level results: 'We've put in the work and we deserve these grades'
item.description: Students in England, Wales and Northern Ireland are told their A-level and BTec results.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Foot Locker boss shares his advice
item.description: Richard Johnson, CEO of Foot Locker, reflects on the lessons of the pandemic for business leaders.

item.title: The illegal gold mines killing rivers and livelihoods in Ghana
item.description: Sixty percent of Ghana's water bodies are now polluted, largely due to illegal mining operations.

item.title: Lithuania blames Belarus for migrant crisis
item.description: Over 4,000 people are reported to have crossed in Lithuania in recent months.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban seizure will challenge West - Gen Sir Nick Carter
item.description: The chief of the defence staff on difficulties ahead if the Taliban illegitimately seize control.

item.title: Nottinghamshire boxer, 64, ends career with world title win
item.description: Steve Ward, previously recognised as the world's oldest male boxer, secures his fairy tale ending.

item.title: England's top women snooker players return to the table
item.description: After an 18-month break due to coronavirus, England's top competitors are back on the baize.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: How the Orielles turned their album into a film score
item.description: The band on surreal gigs at cricket grounds and the "happenings" that inspired their new project.

item.title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
item.description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

item.title: The labels encouraging Chileans to buy healthier food
item.description: Chile's government introduced food labelling five years ago to drive down its high obesity rate.

item.title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
item.description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

item.title: Afghanistan: Why is there a war?
item.description: As foreign forces pull out after 20 years of war, what did it achieve and what happens next?

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: Climate change: Five things we have learned from the IPCC report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Sharing apps are booming but will the kindness continue?
item.description: The pandemic sparked a surge in activity for sharing apps like Olio but has the trend run its course?

item.title: How TV's The Windsors is making its unregal stage debut
item.description: The creator and cast of the royal comedy satire take us behind the scenes of their West End show.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence drama 'celebrates common decency'
item.description: Steve Coogan says it was an honour to play the man who helped convict two men for the teen's murder.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: Gerrard's Rangers crash out of Champions League at hands of 10-man Malmo
item.description: "Fear and panic" cost Rangers as they crashed out of the Champions League after losing to 10-man Malmo at a full Ibrox, says manager Steven Gerrard.

item.title: Spirit win their first men's Hundred match as Originals blow chance of going joint-top
item.description: London Spirit win their first match in the men's Hundred by beating Manchester Originals at Old Trafford.

item.title: 'Messi feels betrayed by Barcelona' - the inside track on new PSG star's Nou Camp exit
item.description: Read the inside track on how Lionel Messi's Barcelona exit came about, with the club legend said to feel betrayed.

item.title: The Hundred: Matt Parkinson, Carlos Braithwaite & Danielle Gibson star as Manchester Originals face London Spirit
item.description: Watch the best of Tuesday's Hundred action as London Spirit do the double over Manchester Originals and win both the women's and men's matches at Old Trafford.

item.title: Olympics: Keely Hodgkinson targets gold in Paris 2024 after Tokyo 2020 success
item.description: Great Britain's Olympic 800m silver medallist Keely Hodgkinson tells BBC Breakfast's Sally Nugent she has her sights set on winning gold.

item.title: The Hundred: Eoin Morgan smashes a six straight at England bowler Olly Stone
item.description: Watch London Spirit captain Eoin Morgan launch a six straight at England bowler Olly Stone as Morgan's side take on Manchester Originals in The Hundred at Old Trafford.

item.title: Sharma stars as Spirit win a tight finish to all-but eliminate Originals
item.description: An excellent all-round performance from Deepti Sharma helps London Spirit beat Manchester Originals in a fascinating back-and-forth game at Old Trafford.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Fertility and miscarriage claims fact-checked
item.description: Posts claiming Covid vaccines cause miscarriages are not supported by scientific evidence.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England, Scotland and Wales but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: The working from home advice in England is set to change on 19 July.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.
